noun.description: Geometry. A circumscribed or inscribed line, especially a tangent of a curve. Now rare and historical.
A comment or note added to a manuscript, especially one which in error becomes incorporated into the text.

adjective.description: Of a feudal serf: hereditarily attached to an estate, and transferred with it.
Written after; opposed to subscript. Chiefly in "iota adscript".

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Bedwell (bap. 1563, d. 1632), Arabist and mathematician. From classical Latin adscrīptus (also ascrīptus), past participle (in post-classical Latin also used as adjective and noun: see note) of adscrībere.
